entry.title: Run Linux Without Desktop Environment
entry.content:
RRM-based Linux

On rpm-based Linux, runlevel 3 means text mode, 5 means X desktop mode. So if you want only start OS without desktop environment, modify runlevel from 5 to 3.

You can do this as root with command: init 3, or modify /etc/inittab file and reboot:

from:

id:5:initdefault:

to:

id:3:initdefault:

Need verified.

Linux Mint

Modify file /boot/grub/grub.cfg, search string “quiet splash”, and add “text” after “splash”, reboot.

Verified 2014/5/5.

Note: /etc/inittab is a config file originally used by init of Unix system V, which is deprecated by most Linux distros now. It’s replaced by upstart or systemd.
